canDo: I can describe past experiences and how they made me feel.

grammar.point: Past tense with adjectives for feelings, linking words for storytelling

rules.title: -ed vs -ing adjectives for feelings
rules.explanation: Use -ed adjectives to describe how you feel. Use -ing adjectives to describe what causes the feeling.
examples: I was excited about the trip.
She felt bored. The movie was boring.
rules.koreanTip: -ed는 '~한 느낌을 받았다', -ing는 '~하게 만드는'이에요. 'I'm boring'이 아니라 'I'm bored'예요!

rules.title: Linking words for sequence
rules.explanation: Use words like 'first', 'then', 'after that', 'finally' to show the order of events.
examples: First, we arrived at the hotel. Then, we went to the beach. After that, we had dinner. Finally, we watched the sunset.
rules.koreanTip: 이야기를 순서대로 말할 때: first(처음에) → then(그 다음에) → after that(그 후에) → finally(마침내)

rules.title: So/Because for explaining reasons
rules.explanation: 'Because' introduces a reason. 'So' introduces a result.
examples: I was tired because I walked all day.
I walked all day, so I was tired.
rules.koreanTip: 'because'는 이유를 말할 때, 'so'는 결과를 말할 때 써요.

exercises.question: The movie was really ___. I almost fell asleep.
exercises.explanation: The movie causes boredom, so use '-ing' adjective.

exercises.question: I was ___ because I passed the exam!
exercises.explanation: Use '-ed' to describe how you feel.

exercises.question: I didn't bring an umbrella, ___ I got wet.

examples: The hike was challenging but rewarding.

words.meaning: feeling too much emotion or having too much to deal with
examples: I felt overwhelmed by the kindness.
words.koreanTip: 감정이나 일이 너무 많아서 벅찬 느낌을 표현해요

examples: After the marathon, I was exhausted.
She looked exhausted from the long day.

reading.title: My First Camping Trip
reading.passage: Last summer, I went camping for the first time. I was both excited and nervous because I had never slept outdoors before. First, we set up the tent. It was more challenging than I expected, but we finally figured it out. Then, we went hiking in the forest. The views were breathtaking! After that, we made a campfire and cooked dinner. The food tasted amazing because we were so hungry. At night, I was a little scared because it was so dark and quiet. However, when I looked up at the stars, I felt amazed. I had never seen so many stars before. It was a truly memorable experience, and I can't wait to go again!

questions.question: How did the writer feel at first about camping?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'I was both excited and nervous.'

questions.question: What made the writer feel amazed at night?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'when I looked up at the stars, I felt amazed.'

questions.question: What does 'breathtaking' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Breathtaking' means so beautiful that it takes your breath away.

listening.title: A Scary Experience
listening.script: I want to tell you about the scariest experience I've ever had. It happened last winter. I was driving home alone at night when suddenly, my car broke down. I was on a dark road in the mountains, and there was no cell phone signal. At first, I was really scared. Then, I decided to walk to find help. After about twenty minutes, I saw a small house with lights on. The people inside were so kind! They let me use their phone and even gave me hot coffee. In the end, a mechanic came to fix my car. I was so relieved! It was a frightening experience, but I learned that there are kind people everywhere.

exercises.question: What happened to the speaker's car?
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'my car broke down.'

exercises.question: The speaker felt ___ when the mechanic fixed the car.
exercises.explanation: The speaker says 'I was so relieved!'

template.prompt: Describe a memorable experience using the template.
template.template: One of my most [ADJECTIVE] experiences was [EVENT]. First, [FIRST EVENT]. I felt [FEELING1] because [REASON1]. Then, [NEXT EVENT]. After that, [THIRD EVENT]. Finally, [CONCLUSION]. In the end, I was [FEELING2]. It was a truly [FINAL ADJECTIVE] experience.
template.correctExample: One of my most exciting experiences was my first skydiving jump. First, I took a training class. I felt nervous because I had never done anything like this before. Then, we got on the plane and flew up very high. After that, I jumped out of the plane with an instructor. Finally, my parachute opened and I landed safely. In the end, I was thrilled. It was a truly unforgettable experience.

free.prompt: Write about a day that was special to you. Describe what happened and how you felt. Use linking words to tell the story in order.

checklist.item: Use at least 3 -ed adjectives for feelings
Use linking words (first, then, after that, finally)

shadowing.sentence: It was the most challenging experience I've ever had, but in the end, I felt really proud of myself because I didn't give up.
shadowing.pronunciation: /ɪt wɑːz ðə moʊst ˈtʃælɪndʒɪŋ ɪkˈspɪriəns aɪv ˈevər hæd bət ɪn ði end aɪ felt ˈriːli praʊd əv maɪˈself bɪˈkɔːz aɪ ˈdɪdnt ɡɪv ʌp/
shadowing.koreanTip: 'challenging'의 'ch'는 '취' 소리, 'experience'의 강세는 두 번째 음절 'pe'에 있어요.

roleplay.scenario: You are telling a friend about an interesting experience.

prompts.speaker: partner
prompts.text: Did anything interesting happen to you recently?

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: Yes! I had a really ___ experience. Let me tell you about it.

prompts.speaker: user
prompts.text: Then, ___. In the end, I felt ___.

koreanErrors.explanation: Use '-ed' for how you feel, '-ing' for what causes the feeling.
koreanErrors.tip: 'I'm boring'은 '나는 지루한 사람이야'라는 뜻이 돼요! 지루함을 느끼면 'I'm bored'를 쓰세요.

koreanErrors.explanation: The movie causes boredom, so use '-ing'.
koreanErrors.tip: 영화는 감정을 유발하는 것이므로 'boring'을 써요. 'bored'는 사람에게 써요.
